On this day, August 14, 1473 ~ Birth of Margaret Pole, 8th Countess of Salisbury, daughter of George, Duke of Clarence

Lady Margaret was born at Farleigh Hungerford Castle in Somerset .

Her mother Isabel , Duchess of Clarence died in 1476 and her father George, Duke of Clarence in 1478. Lady Margaret only surviving sibling her brother Edward , 17th Earl of Warwick was later executed in 1499 by Henry VII on charges on treason.

On this day, August 17, 1153 ~ Birth of William, Count of Poitiers, son of King Henry II of England, in Normandy, France

Sadly the first born son of Henry and Eleanor only had a short life and died aged just 2 and was buried near his grandfather Henry I at the Abbey of Reading.

19th of August 1284 : Death of Alphonso, Earl of Chester

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alphonso,_Earl_of_Chester

Alfonso was the son of King Edward I of England and Eleanor of Castile and his body was buried at Confessor's Chapel at Westminster Abbey and his heart at the now destroyed Blackfriars Prior in London.

On this day, August 21, 1765 ~ Birth of King William IV of Great Britain at Buckingham House in London, England. Buckingham House at this time was not Buckingham Palace.

At the time of his birth he had 2 older brothers and was never expected to be king.

George ,The Prince of Wales born 1762 and later George IV

Frederick, Duke of York and Albany born in 1763

The future king William IV's baptism took place at St James's Palace on the 20th of September 1765

24th of August 1507 : Death of Cecily of York, Viscountess Welles

Cecily was the third surviving daughter of Edward IV and Elizabeth Woodville and lived through the reigns of Edwatd IV,Richard III and Henry VII.

In 1487 she was married to Ralph Scrope but this was later annulled and later to John Welles, 1st Viscount Welles who was a half brother of Lady Margaret Beaufort.

Cecily died at East Standen in the Isle of Wight and was buried at

Quarr Abbey on the Isle of Wight.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cecily_of_York

On this day, August 29, 1189 ~ The Wedding of John (King John) of England and Isabella, Countess of Gloucester at Marlborough Castle in Wiltshire, England

An Ard Ri

Super Moderator

Joined

Jun 30, 2009

Messages

43,280

City

An Iarmhí

Country

Ireland

On this day, August 29, 1189 ~ The Wedding of John (King John) of England and Isabella, Countess of Gloucester at Marlborough Castle in Wiltshire, England

The marriage ended in an annulment after John became king and Isabella later married Hubert de Burgh ,Earl of Kent.

The countess ended her days at Keynsham Abbey in Somerset.

King John went onto marry Isabella d'Angouleme in 1200.
